Catherine is about 7 pounds of wiggles and love, she is happy and friendly and  gets along with all other animals.  She will make a wonderful addition to any family.  She is bonded with JR the father of her  litters before being surrendered to the Sanctuary they are very much a bonded pair and it would be great if they could be placed together.

Archie is around 3 years old and weighs 9-10 pounds.  He looks a lot bigger because of all the hair.  He's a very affectionate dog, gets along with people well.  He's very sweet and loving.  We have no idea what breed he is, but he's beautiful in person.  He is very animated and active.  Archie needs to be with a strong, experienced owner.  A home with fewer distractions would be just fine for him. He would do well as an only dog, or with a playmate about the same size.  A fenced-in yard is required.  
 
Please email us for an application.

Go to our website at www.dachshundrescueofohio.org to fill out an application.  The application can now be completed online through the site and is automatically emailed to us.

Thank you.

FOSTER HOMES NEEDED!
Brussels Griffon & Affenpinscher â¢ Adult â¢ Male/Female â¢ Small
Spayed/Neutered â¢ Current on vaccinations â¢ Prefers a home without: Young Children
 
American Brussels Griffon Rescue Alliance (ABGRA) & American Affenpinscher Rescue (AAR) needs more volunteers to fulfill our mission to rescue, rehabilitate and find loving forever homes for dogs in need.

We primarily focus on rescuing Brussels Griffons, Affenpinschers and mixes of these toy breeds. ABGRAâs rescued Griffs and Affens come from shelters, breeders and owner surrenders. 

ABGRA currently needs foster homes in the Midwest and on the West Coast, especially in Arkansas, Kansas, Missouri, Illinois, Iowa, and Southern California.  If you are an adult over 25 years old, work from home, do not have young children, have a securely fenced yard, have experience with dogs and can offer your time and love for Griffs and Affens in need, you may qualify to be a foster home! 

Many of our Griffs and Affens are rescued in the Lower Midwest, so they also need transport to our foster homes in other areas.  We are a charitable 501c3 organization, so fuel to transport these dogs is tax deductible to the extent allowed by law, as are monetary donations.

Please go to our website, www.abgra.org.  You will find more information there and our foster home application, which is required for fostering and/or transporting.  If you cannot volunteer, but would still like to help, tax deductible monetary donations for veterinary care are always needed too!  ABGRA provides complete veterinary care for our rescued dogs, including spay/neuter, vaccinations, heart worm tests/preventative and other vet care as needed.

Please join with us to help rescued Griffs and Affens become healthy, happy dogs, enabling them to find their forever, loving homes.  You will discover that nurturing and rehabilitating these precious little dogs will be one of the most rewarding experiences of your life!
He has a terrier personality.  He loves people.  Please text 513 383 0202 for more information.

Hi, my name is Buster! I'm a handsome Shepherd/Afghan Hound mix and am around 11 yrs old. I would do best in a home where I am the "only" dog, because, well, once you meet me, you will see that I will be your "one and only" :). I have to admit, I don't like to share attention with other furkids. There are some things you should know about me: I am not fond of children under 16 years of age, I don't like cats, dogs, or other animals (unless it is to torment them which is not a real good idea), and I am definitely a lady's man. That is, I bond better with women than I do men. Since I am the jealous type and do have an issue with men in general, just so you know, if I do go to a home with a male presence, please be aware that it may take time for me to be comfortable with him. I know that is a tall order but my wish is to spend my golden years being loved and cared for, and, well, I am a guy who knows what I need. I weighed in at 75 lbs so I am an "extra-large size" - which just means that there is more of me to love. If you are seriously interested in adopting me, and think I may be the guy in your life, please stop by the Adoption Center.

Nosey is available January 2018 after heartworm treatment and followup testing.  Sweetheart of a dog.  Watch for updates

Nosey is about 5 years and 9 months.  She was surrendered by an elderly gentleman when he could no longer care for the dog.  She was matted and had to have her legs, butt, and underside all shaved down shortly after arrival.  She tested positive for heartworms and was treated.   She is a very sweet and calm dog.  She weighs between 55 and 60 lbs.   She is overweight.  She walks well on a leash and gets along with other dogs.  She is the height of a medium size dog.

*MARLEY IS A COURTESY POST*

This is beautiful, regal Marley. Marley and his "sister" Gypsy are looking for their forever homes. They've been together for the past 3 years, (Marley is 5 years young) but circumstances have changed with their family and they sadly must rehome them both. Marley is a neutered, part Afghan Hound/Shepherd mix boy who weighs in at about 65lbs. He is tall and thin like his Afghan side of the family. Marley's family describes him as obedient, cautious and very eager to please them. He is extremely affectionate and really prefers to be around his people as much as possible. If you are looking for an "outside dog", then neither Marley nor Gypsy fit that bill as they have both been inside members of their family!
Marley's mom reports that he has a health condition that she will detail with any interested, potential adopters. 
Marley is neutered, up to date on vaccinations and heartworm preventative, leash and housetrained.
Marley's family would like to see them be adopted together but realize that might not be possible. Their number one goal is to find their dogs a loving home (or homes) where they will be treated like family and given lots of love and attention.

If you would like to learn more about Marley, please email his mom at: azadehfarzin57@gmail.com 

Marley is located in Charlottesville, VA

Desert is a 6 year old male pit bull mix who was surrendered to the shelter. Desert is good with other dogs but is not good with cats. For a little guy he's very strong so he will need a strong experienced owner and for that reason should be in a home with adults only, no small children. Desert is very friendly ,he's house broken and he loves to play with toys. He especially loves to be outside playing and loves when you throw a ball to him. He would do well with an active family

Adoption fee s $150 plus license fee

Hi there. My name is Boosa, In Afghanistan it means Kiss. Paw calls me Boo Kitty (from Monster Inc) .When I first got here to Marley's World I was so grateful I couldn't stop kissing Paw. My old master got evicted and left me outside with another dog. We were the lucky ones. Some of the other dogs abandoned were locked up and did not survive. After a lot of love and care and good food I am healthy and happy. 
I am often mistaken for a Black and Tan coon hound around here but I am an ancient and royal breed. I am a sight hound and I take looking and watching what goes on around me very seriously.  Nothing escapes my gaze. I love to sit calmly and get patted. I may come across as a little aloof but that is because I am very dignified. I am most definitely not an "Odie". My breed is very loyal. Paw loves me a lot but I am saving my heart for someone special. If you are looking for intelligence, love and loyalty in a companion it just might be you. You can find out more about me by calling Paw at 870-291-0365 or better yet  e-mail him at kylepigman@verizon.net To find out more about ICARE or to fill out an adoption application go to icare-ark.com    ???????

Meet Moose!   Moose is an 18 month old neutered boy that is microchipped and UTD on his vaccinations.  His sire was a brindle colored Afghan Hound and his dam was a German Shorthaired Pointer.   He is incredibly sweet, very affectionate and just wants to be wherever his human is.   He is food motivated and eager to please.   Moose gets anxious when left alone but he is doing well with crate training and positive reinforcement.  He walks well on leash and knows limited basic commands.   As a puppy, Moose was repeatedly attacked by another dog in his home and is now unsure of interactions with other dogs.  He can greet them on-leash but quickly becomes unsure and can become fearful and overwhelmed.  For this reason, we feel he would be most successful in an only dog home.   The ideal adopter would have hound experience â both breeds are active and agile and have high prey drives.  A 6â fence is a requirement.   NEAHR is committed to providing Moose with the tools he needs to be successful in a forever home.  He will begin both private and group training lessons in January.   Moose is in foster care in Salem, NH with North East Afghan Hound Rescue, Inc.   
For more information about Moose, please contact NEAHR at neahr@comcast.net.   Adoption applications can be found at www.neahr.org.    Home visit will be required prior to placement.

An adoption application can be completed anytime at http://www.OnMyWayHomeRescue.com. Pepper is a 6 to 7 year-old long-haired Silken Windhound male who came into rescue after his owner passed away. He is super friendly and sweet, with a tendency to gaze very gently deep into your eyes...unforgettable. He enjoys walks and cuddles. Since he is a sight hound, Pepper will need a family who understands his special characteristics. His adoption fee is $250.00. 

If you are interested in adopting this dog, please complete an adoption application at http://www.onmywayhomerescue.com.  You will be contacted within 24-48 hours to answer any additional questions you may have regarding the dog and the adoption process.  Thank you for your interest!

What an eye-catcher! Handsome Romeo lives up to his name. He is a love even though, he's nervous around strangers and has to be introduced slowly with the professional obedience training, he has received. Once comfortable, Romeo is all love. He is super affectionate and happy! Romeo loves to snuggle up, play with his toys but most of all, he loves to please you! Romeo will thrive in a calm adult home with yard access, that will continue his training. Romeo has lived in a home and is very well behaved. He loves to go on car rides and nice walks in the park. Romeo's beautiful red coat draws attention and he gets tons of compliments, wherever he goes!
Ingrid (310) 480 6030
pcdrapps@yahoo.com
If you would like to meet this cutie, please complete the adoption application:
http://www.pcdogrescue.org/about-us/application.html

Do you need a quirky dog in your life? Fynnigan Fitzgerald is the pooch for you. He is about five years old, neutered, mostly ignores dogs and cats and is good with people. He was named Fling when we picked him up from Genesee County Animal Control because he would fling himself at the cage door so no caging for him. But he doesn't need it - he's a good boy. He is a bed hog. His DNA test reports that he is Boston Terrier, Airedale Terrier and other mixes. He doesn't have a drop of pitbull in him. If you want to share your home with a character, fill out an application at flintcitypits.com

Hi, my name is "Poe". My D.O.B is 8/8/14. I LOVE to swim. Swimming and playing fetch are two of my most favorite activities. I don't really enjoy playing with other dogs, but can be around dogs that won't get in my face. I can be a little mouthy sometimes, so I would prefer a home without any small kids. I would love to be adopted by a family that is really active and has the time to work on teaching me new commands. Please come see me soon!

Meet-Your-Match Canineality color is:Orange-Goofball!!!
For safety's sake, we are looking for homes with physical fenced in areas.
Please fill out our online adoption survey at www.mackenzies.info

Baby is 5 years old and weighs about 50 pounds. She arrived at our facility when her owner had passed away and there was no next of kin to take her in. She seems to love everyone she meets and will greet you with a tail wag and a kiss. This princess loves going for walks, playing with toys, and most of all just loves being by your side. She has potential with other dogs but they need to be as laid back as she is. Baby hopes you stop down to meet her today!

To adopt one of our animals, please visit our shelter, open Tuesday-Saturday from Noon-5pm. You may also submit an application online from our website at http://www.HelpTheAnimalsINC.com or our Facebook page at http://www.facebook.com/HelpTheAnimalsInc

Mr. Smiley, who weâve grown to call Smiley for short is a real bundle of fun and energy! Though he is still getting used to his new life in the city â and all the noises that come with it â he is a very affectionate and full of life! He will need a patient home, and one that is willing to work with him through his training and through his anxieties. Smiley needs a durable harness for walking, as his anxieties are triggered by very loud noises; a home outside of the city will be considered for this guy!

He is also friendly with other dogs, however, no one likes someone too close in their bubble, and Mr. Smiley is no exception. He prefers dogs that are more mild-mannered, doesnât matter the size he likes them all, and has not been tested with cats. If you are someone who works from home and has time to dedicate to this sweet and fun-loving guys, then Smiley would be a great match for you! He does have some separation anxieties as well; patience required.

If you love a scruffy beautiful Mutt, then this is the guy for you! Apply to adopt Smiley today!

Please read our adoption policies before applying!







For more info on a particular dog, please contact adopt@redemptionpaws.org or visit our website at http://redemptionpaws.org and be sure to make sure we adopt in your area!

Hi Iâm Polly! Iâm a 2-year old, 35-40lb Beagle/Airedale mix gal! I just came into rescue after I had babies and now that theyâve found homes, itâs my turn! Iâm an all around happy girl, good with other dogs, house broken, crate trained and loving to all people! I just canât wait to meet you and I know we are going to best friends!!!!

Little Bear is definitely a big teddy bear. He is very affectionate and calm. He enjoys playing with other dogs and would make an excellent companion for a lonely dog.  He was brought to our shelter because his owners were moving. Little Bear would be a great dog for a loving home that is willing to keep him forever!! Come meet him and let him give you a big bear hug. 

As a shelter we can not fully guarantee the breed of our animals, but rely on the physical characteristics to make an educated guess. We also do our best estimating the dog's age, and adult size if he/she is still a puppy.

Our usual fee for our dogs and puppies is $120 which covers the veterinary work done on the pet. That includes heartworm testing for dogs older than 6 months, age-appropriate vaccinations, spay/neuter surgery, microchip, and treatment for fleas and ticks. 

Prior to adoption we require an approved pre-adoption application which can be found on our website www.ncanimalservices.org. If you are interested in any of our adoptable animals please fill out an application to start the adoption process.

Kids: Yes Cats: Yes Dogs: Yes Colby is one of our most interesting and smartest dogs here! He has a very unique personality and knows exactly what to do to get what he wants! His shaggy look is adorable and gets even cuter when he throws his kicking tantrums when he doesn't get enough attention! Colby loves being outside! He loves it so much; it's hard to convince him to come in even on rainy days! He enjoys going for walks, playing tug and playing with his friend Maverick in the yard. Colby loves other dogs, along with cats! Colby loves his stuffies and treats, but can be possessive over his toys and food. Because of this, he would need to be homed with no children, few visitors and someone who is willing to work on his guarding behaviors. This is completely manageable however should be taken seriously to ensure the comfort and safety of Colby and his lucky person! Colby may also take a bit to warm up to people, and needs somebody who is willing to come up and meet him a few times before being able to handle him and take him home! This guy is a hoot and would make a lucky person very happy, come see Colby and take him home!

Daphne has had many looks while she's been with us. This is her well-groomed look. Daphne's normal coat is longer and very curly..

Daphne has been adopted out before and returned. When she was younger, she would chase the children to herd them and nip at their heels.

Since that time and in growing older, Daphne bonds to her adult human companions and then acts protective of them by growling at strangers.

However, when corrected by the person she is with, she stops growling.

We are looking for a home for Daphne that has no children due to Daphne's nature to be protective.

We think Daphne would be a great companion for a single individual or couple who is wiling to verbally correct Daphne if she begins to growl because she's being protective.

With her human companion that she bonds with and loves, Daphne is a dedicated and loyal dog.

This puppy is in Tennessee. Adoption Donation $225 if picked up in TN, $275 plus transport fee for out of state adoptions.

Three cheers for Teddy, who is starting his new life as a rescued dog! Teddy is a Boston Terrier/Airedale Terrier *we are guessing* mix who weighs about 21 pounds. Itâs hard to believe that he hasnât always had that gorgeous coat but Teddy has fully recovered from a skin infection - it just shows that some tender loving care can do wonders for our canine friends. We are happy to report that Teddy has a long, comfortable life ahead of him now--as he is only about 4 months old. Like any happy puppy, he is active, playful, and overjoyed to be around people and other dogs. He does like to try and be a tough guy at times, but does well on a leash and is doing great with his other training. Teddy had spa day twice a week for medicated baths that he actually enjoyed because he likes to always look like a doggie super model. A bath now and then would make him happy. If youâd like Teddy to play a starring role in your life, please apply today!

Meet Teddy @ Petco in Cookeville on Sat, April 14th from 1-5pm.

Petco

377 W Jackson St#11

Cookeville, TN 38501

Visit our website to fill out the application. Dog Adoption Application: http://aarf-tn.com/adopt/adoption-app/

Cat Adoption Application: http://aarf-tn.com/adopt/cat-adoption-application/

If you are interested in this pet but have questions, visit the Pet Inquiry Form: http://aarf-tn.com/contact/pet-inquiry-form/.

THIS PET IS FOSTERED IN TENNESSEE! We do list and adopt our pets nationwide. Typical transport cost to the Northeast is $160, but may be less depending on your location (Due to interstate adoption regulations, we are not able to adopt to RI and MA state residents.)

A.A.R.F. (All About Rescue and Fixin' Inc.) http://aarf-tn.com/ is a non-profit, 501(c)(3) no kill animal rescue organization located in the Upper Cumberland area of Tennessee. A.A.R.F. is comprised of unpaid volunteers and survives only on public donations. Thank you for thinking adoption first!

Prior to adoption, all canines and felines are spayed or neutered, have received their age appropriate vaccinations, have been de-wormed for common parasites, and have received treatment for prevention of fleas and ticks. All canines over the age of 6 months have been tested for heartworm. All canines are put on heartworm prevention as soon as possible - this means dogs as soon as they are tested negative. Puppies are put on prevention immediately. All felines, regardless of age, have been tested for Feline Leukemia/FIV. Each animal receives a health check by a licensed veterinarian prior to adoption. Anything else found will be treated by our organization prior to adoption.
4/11/18 6:19 PM

Meet Esther!

Esther is a 4 month old Airedale mix. She is very playful, affectionate, brave, and loves exploring the outdoors! 

She is excellent with the kids and good with the dogs, but she does pester the dogs for constant play, so a future dog sibling would be a good match for her activity level. She is not house trained at all, so her foster family is helping her with that and new family would need to continue. 

She is smart and eager to learn, so we've already made some progress working on her puppy manners (jumping, mouthing, etc). Her foster family is giving her a good head start, but she would also benefit from some continued puppy basics training and socialization. 

She is such a sweet and fun little girl, can't wait to see her find a forever family to love!!

Adult dog adoptions include - spay/neuter, vaccines, microchip, 4dx, fecal, and flea preventative.  

Puppy adoptions include - spay/neuter, vaccines including boosters, microchip, fecal,  and flea preventative 

Adoptions are held every Saturday from 10am-3pm at our shelter (1049 Macarthur Road in Whitehall across the street from the old Lehigh Valley Dairy)

Miss Mia is a 4 yr. old Airedale/Lab mix. She is currently on the mend at The Humane Society of Kent County, after undergoing surgery to repair an old ACL injury in December. The costly procedure was made possible by a generous discount from a local veterinarian, and a Kent County High School student/ HSKC intern who raised enough money to cover the cost.

Mia came through the procedure like a champ!

Mia lived with little dogs in her previous home. She seems to like little dogs a lot and does well in play groups with them. She does have a history of chasing and being a little to dominate so we would suggest she go to a home with no other dogs at this time. Mia prefers the company of adults. She can be slow to warm up at first, but this highly intelligent girl would love a home where she can be the center of attention. She has a low to moderate energy level and a look all of her own. She can be protective of her territory and her people. She is housebroken and likes to keep her space tidy.

If you think that you could help Mia get back on her feet and if you think this pup could be a forever fit in your family, please call HSKC today!

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Elsa is a pretty girl who came to us from Arizona, as part of an extreme hoarding case. She and the other dogs that were rescued had been left in the field with livestock and not well socialized with people. Elsa is friendly but cautious on meeting new people and she has shown us that she prefers living in the house rather than in the pasture. She has grown quite a bit in her socialization since she has been with us, and is now a friendly and well adjusted member of our house pack. Due to the number of dogs that we might have at any one time, our house can be a bit chaotic at times, and Elsa has shown us that she would do best in a home with a peaceful and quiet environment.

Elsa is safe with both goats and chickens, and one of her favorite activities is to go out to the chicken yard with us every day, although she's ready to come back to the house when you are.

Elsa does well in a crate, but she is reliably house-trained, so she doesn't need a crate. She gets along well with other dogs, but doesn't seem to need the company of another dog in order to be happy. When she has been around puppies, Elsa has been very protective of them, so if you are looking for a companion for a puppy, Elsa would definitely be a good choice. She has been vaccinated, spayed, microchipped, and heartworm tested (negative), so she is ready to go to a new home! Submit your application on our website today. 4/7/18 11:05 AM

"Grizzly Bear" is a 2 1/2 year old Maremma Sheep Dog/Turkish Kangal mix.  A Turkish Kangal is not acknowledged by the AKC, but is similar in size and conformation to an Akbash.  This breed is a "guardian of flocks" and takes his job very seriously.  He has lived for the past 2 years on a large property in Valentine, Nebraska and is gentle and mellow with people he knows, but as per his breed can be very protective.  "Griz" is housetrained, but actually prefers to live outside year-round.  

We are searching for a home with some acreage where he can patrol, yet have human and animal contact.  He is a great working dog if you have sheep to guard as he would be a natural.  We are hoping to get him back to his previous foster home here in Cody where he enjoyed perching on a front porch and going in and out a doggie-door into a large workshop.  Many people fear this breed as they can be very protective and guarding and sound extremely ferocious.  They are LIVESTOCK guardians, so please know your breed.  He is OK with ducks and geese, but will go after chickens!

"Grizzly Bear" is neutered and will be brought current on his vaccinations and ready for a new home.  His adoption fee is $200 and he will come with his paperwork and proof of vaccinations.  Email kathy@3dogrescue.com for an application and call Kathy at (307) 587-4794 for an appointment to meet this amazing puppy.

Last Day Dog Rescue now microchips all animals before adoption. Microchips are implanted between the animals shoulder blades and are a permanent form of identification. The microchips are registered to Last Day Dog Rescue with the adopter's info added once adopted. If the animal is ever lost and slips his/her collar/tags the microchip allows the finder to know who to contact if scanned for a microchip. Animals MUST still have a collar with tags on at all times. Per our contract, we take all our animals back if for any reason you can't keep your adopted animal.

The Petfinder.com system requires that we choose a predominant breed or breed mix for our animals. Visual breed identification in animals is unreliable so for most of the animals we are only guessing at predominant breed or breed mix. We get to know each animal as an individual and will do our best to describe each of our animals based on personality, not by breed label.

Thank you for looking through our list of animals needing forever homes and choosing rescue first. We appreciate you stopping by.

Adoption Fee is $ Adoption fee covers for our Adoption Package for dogs which may include if over 6 months of age: heart worm checked, treated for any fleas and worms, microchipped, up to date rabies vaccination, spayed/neutered, Distemper vaccinations, basicÂ and problem solving training before and after adoption if needed. Full health records are provided to the adopters.The Adoption fee we ask of adopters is not to pay for the dog. The dog itself is free!Â  The Adoption fee is used merely to reimburse our rescue for veterinary expenses that any responsible owner would spend anyway when bringing a new dog into their home. Howeverever if there are any funds left over from one dogs adoption fee, it is used to help the next dog that comes along. Sometimes FSFH's veterinarian expenses on one animal will be less than this fee, but another dog might require several hundred additional dollars worth of care. Without being able to recover at least the minimal veterinarian expenses on our dogs, FSFH could not continue to rescue. FSFH's fee does not cover the general cost of keeping a dog in rescue (food, equipment, etc.). FSFH relies solely on donations to cover all other expenses related to caring for their rescued dogs. Thank you for understanding.If interested in adopting please go to www.fewstepsfromhome.com to get an application.We also accept donations of dog food, cat food, cat litter, and large durable dog toys. Katja (Kah tya) is a super sweet three year old girl who was picked up as a stray in Ohio. She had a chip and the owner on record was contacted but she had placed Katja two years ago and did not want to claim her. The Ohio shelter reached out to us and thankfully we had a space for her. She's currently being fostered in Grand Rapids.

Katja is a typical three year old that still has some maturing to do. When she wants something her way she turns into a two year old child having a temper tantrum including the screeching, and that is the only negative thing her foster mom says Katja has. It's obvious she has not been exposed to many situations and sounds as she spooks at loud noises and is a bit insecure in new situations. Katja loves people and being the center of attention (as most Mals do). When she went to a private groomer she was not happy about being restrained. Thankfully her groomer has groomed hundreds of malamutes so Katja met her match on that one. She also took a trip to our local Pet Supplies Plus store. Who knew it was going to turn into a meet and greet session! 

She is still learning how to walk on a leash without pulling, and her foster mom is working on stopping the jumping habit (on people, furniture, countertops, etc). She loves squeaky toys but she can destroy one in about 15 minutes. Shreds tennis balls too. Rope toys are best for her as she can shred the strands all she wants but the knot stays in one piece and the Kong toys are surviving as well. Other than the jumping Katja is very well behaved in the house. All the houseplants are still intact, when it's time for bed she sleeps at the foot of the bed, totally house trained, absolutely loves going for car rides and meeting new people. We were told she was dog aggressive so we limit her exposure to other dogs (although she loves running along the fence with a one year old neighbor pittie boy. Wears both of them out!)
Katja will do best in a home with no other pets or small children and one very experienced with stubborn Northern breeds as she pushes boundaries any chance she gets. She came to us at 88 lbs and so far has lost 11 lbs in five weeks. She needs to weigh 70-72 lbs at the most as she's right on breed standard for a young female as far as height. In general, Malamutes mature at age 5-6 so she's still in her puppy phase mentally.

Is Katja the perfect girl for your home?

ADOPTION DONATION:  $250  Before adoption, all Northern Lights dogs (regardless of whether Petfinder's symbols appear) are spayed or neutered, microchipped, heartworm negative, fully vaccinated and tested/treated for known parasites.
 
WHAT TO DO IF YOU WANT TO ADOPT THIS DOG:  Email us at ADOPTASLEDDOG@AOL.COM to request an application and get started.  WE DO NOT HAVE AN ONLINE APPLICATION - you will have to request one via email.  We will review your application to determine if there is a good fit between you and/or your family and this dog.  We may suggest another dog or dog(s) if we can offer a better fit in terms of lifestyle, experience, other pets, etc.  A vet check, reference checks, and a home visit will be conducted before an adoption can be considered for approval.  
 
NORTHERN LIGHTS DOES NOT HAVE A PHYSICAL SHELTER.  We are a nonprofit rescue organization comprised of individuals who open their private homes to foster dogs in need of a second chance..  When fosters are not available, we often pay to board a dog until space is available.  New fosters and donations to pay for boarding are always desperately needed us.  Email us at KATYLIED2@AOL.COM if you are interested in donating or for information on fostering.
 
FAQ:  For information regarding our organization, as well as adoption policies and practices, please visit our Petfinder Home Page at WWW.NORTHERNLIGHTS.PETFINDER.COM.
 
 
NOTICE:  In the vast majority of cases, the dogs in our program and rescued from shelters, and Northern Lights has no means by which to collect or verify a dog's history.  We work in concert with our veterinarians, and breed and age estimates are based on a combination of professional input and our collective experience.  Our policy with information acquired prior to acceptance and while the dogs are in our care is that of "full disclosure".  It is our goal to ensure the adopter has all available information to ensure the best possible match between the dog and the adopter(s).  If we have identified a behavioral or health condition while the dog is in our care and custody, every effort will be made to correct it prior to adoption, OR the adopter will be made aware of the issue or condition prior to adoption.  Northern Lights' screening process is designed to identify only those adopters who are willing, and have the means, to treat conditions which may occur after adoption, and the adopter will be contractually responsible for doing so. However, Northern Lights' policy is to accept any adopted dog back into the program, at any time, for any reason.

Please make sure you CHECK ON THE PETFINDER VIDEO ICON, above, to see a video of this wonderful dog!  Our videos will include, at a minimum, whatever info we had on the dog upon (or shortly after) his/her arrival into our program.  There will sometimes be video updates as well.  And in every case, our Adoptions Coordinator can be emailed at ADOPTASLEDDOG@AOL.COM to answer questions and provide the most current information we have on the dog.  

NOTES:  Please see video or contact our Adoptions Coordinator at ADOPTASLEDDOG@AOL.COM.

ADOPTION DONATION:  $250  Before adoption, all Northern Lights dogs (regardless of whether Petfinder's symbols appear) are spayed or neutered, microchipped, heartworm negative, fully vaccinated and tested/treated for known parasites.
 
WHAT TO DO IF YOU WANT TO ADOPT THIS DOG:  Email us at ADOPTASLEDDOG@AOL.COM to request an application and get started.  WE DO NOT HAVE AN ONLINE APPLICATION - you will have to request one via email.  We will review your application to determine if there is a good fit between you and/or your family and this dog.  We may suggest another dog or dog(s) if we can offer a better fit in terms of lifestyle, experience, other pets, etc.  A vet check, reference checks, and a home visit will be conducted before an adoption can be considered for approval.  
 
NORTHERN LIGHTS DOES NOT HAVE A PHYSICAL SHELTER.  We are a nonprofit rescue organization comprised of individuals who open their private homes to foster dogs in need of a second chance..  When fosters are not available, we often pay to board a dog until space is available.  New fosters and donations to pay for boarding are always desperately needed us.  Email us at KATYLIED2@AOL.COM if you are interested in donating or for information on fostering.
 
FAQ:  For information regarding our organization, as well as adoption policies and practices, please visit our Petfinder Home Page at WWW.NORTHERNLIGHTS.PETFINDER.COM.
 
 
NOTICE:  In the vast majority of cases, the dogs in our program and rescued from shelters, and Northern Lights has no means by which to collect or verify a dog's history.  We work in concert with our veterinarians, and breed and age estimates are based on a combination of professional input and our collective experience.  Our policy with information acquired prior to acceptance and while the dogs are in our care is that of "full disclosure".  It is our goal to ensure the adopter has all available information to ensure the best possible match between the dog and the adopter(s).  If we have identified a behavioral or health condition while the dog is in our care and custody, every effort will be made to correct it prior to adoption, OR the adopter will be made aware of the issue or condition prior to adoption.  Northern Lights' screening process is designed to identify only those adopters who are willing, and have the means, to treat conditions which may occur after adoption, and the adopter will be contractually responsible for doing so. However, Northern Lights' policy is to accept any adopted dog back into the program, at any time, for any reason.

name.$t: Daisy is a Sanctuary Sweetheart now

description.$t:
08/05/13 UPDATE
Sweet Daisy has joined IAMRA's Sanctuary Sweetheart Club. Sanctuary Sweethearts at IAMRA are dogs that for various reasons are deemed unadoptable.Â  So IAMRA will provide them with their forever homes.Â  Many many thanks to those of you who provide your continuing donations to help us care for our dogs!!!
Daisy is a senior who will be enjoying her golden years in a wonderful foster home, with a fabulous yard where she can rest under the shade of a tree or sleep in the soft ivy that catches her fancy.Â  She has already captured her the heart of her foster home and is enjoying the serenity and love that is showered upon her.
If you are interested in being one of Daisy's sponsors, to help with her life-long expenses, please visit us at www.IAMRA.org to see how you can help us make her twilight years wonderful!
Â 
02/27/12 Update: Daisy is a chubby older girl (about 7) that was out of time at a downstate shelter - the shelter worked very hard to get her safely to us! She seems like a very sweet girl.  She loves women and children, but is fearful of men. She gets along well with some other dogs, but can be choosy about her canine companions sometimes. She is doing great in her foster home, as she waits for her own forever home.

Dalton has been fostered with Kim and Tess for so long now, he is comfortable with them and has become a part of their family, so the decision has been made, because of his special needs to make him a sanctuary dog and stay with his fosters.  Dalton acts much younger than his age of 8 years. Dalton is a dog extremely sensitive to his environment. He will thrive in a home with structure, gentle and firm discipline and a lot of love and guidance. He will sense any stress and whine and cry incessantly. He will not do well spending hours on end alone or with just another dog for company. He does okay with some other dogs, but by far prefers humans and will climb on your lap for some snuggle time. He also does well with children. He particularly loves ones that are just a little bit older, 8 years old and up is best.

Sanctuary Sweethearts at IAMRA are dogs that for various reasons are deemed unadoptable.  So IAMRA will provide them with their forever homes.  Many many thanks to those of you who provide your continuing donations to help us care for our dogs! 

If you would like to donate towards Dalton's care, please visit our website at www.iamra.org

Handsome Dylan is coming back to IAMRA. He is one of malamute Ashaâs puppies born seven years ago.  Unfortunately, due to lifestyle changes, Dylanâs people are unable to keep him. He is a well mannered boy, housebroken and crate trained, and does well with most dogs that respect him. He does NOT get along with cats. We have found Dylan to be shy with men, so he needs someone who understands this and will take the time to slowly earn his trust.

If you are interested in this dog, or any of our other dogs, please go to www.iamra.org and fill out an online application.

New girl coming to IAMRA the end of June â meet Izzy!
Izzy is a 5 year old girl, that sadly is heartworm positive.
More about Izzy after she arrives and we get to know her. Donations for her HW treatment greatly appreciated!

If you are interested in this dog, or any of our other dogs, please go to www.iamra.org and fill out an online application.

Meet Riley!  Riley is a Malberian - her Mom is a Siberian Husky, her Dad an Alaskan Malamute. Riley is just 7 months old (born December 16th 2016). Riley was part of an accidental litter and is in need of a home, as is her sister Gabby. Riley is a very sweet girl and very playful.  She seems to have inherited more of her malamute dad's temperament as she has a more calm demeanor, but it also means she would do best with a male companion. She is also showing a bit of a prey drive, so homes without cats or smaller dogs would be best.  We are working on Riley's crate training.  She seems to do OK as long as no one is home when she's crated, but if someone is, you will hear about her displeasure.

If you are interested in this dog, or any of our other dogs, please go to www.iamra.org and fill out an online application.

Due to change in life circumstances, 7 year old Toby who was adopted out by us as a pup (one of Momma Annie's,  originally Goku) has come back to us. Poor Toby was bounced around to a couple of homes before he finally was picked up by animal control and made it to a shelter where his microchip was scanned and the shelter thankfully contacted us. He is obviously mixed, though we know his mom Annie is a malamute.  From all reports he is a very sweet boy, but will jump lower fences.  More info as we get to know Toby again.

If you are interested in this dog, or any of our other dogs, please go to www.iamra.org and fill out an online application.

Meet Stormy and Thunder. These two sweet 9 year old boys are the product of a divorce. Unfortunately, they havenât had good care in quite some time, and have some pretty bad problems because of that. Both boys are very overweight, have very bad ear infections, Stormy (darker) has one ruptured ACL (very painful!) and the other one is going, and Thunder (lighter)  has issues with both rear tarsals (ankles).  These are two of the nicest boysâ¦but they need a LOT of help to get healthy.  They will need special food, supplements, and medications to help get them ready for potential surgeries (they are not currently surgical candidates due to their weight and other problems).  These are two of the NICEST dogs that have come through our doors.  Please help us help them to be healthy again, and find the loving new homes they deserve.   Itâs bad enough to be homeless for the holidays â but to be homeless AND hurting so much, well, that really stinks for these poor handsome fellows  ;-( 

If you are interested in this dog, or any of our other dogs, please go to www.iamra.org and fill out an online application.

Fable and Inca have arrived from MO, where as strays, in true malamute fashion, fended for themselves by eating a farmer's chickens. A kind samaritan took them in to keep them out of further trouble until we could get them to us. They are reportedly very sweet and around 3 - 4 years old. More information as we get to know them.

If you are interested in this dog, or any of our other dogs, please go to www.iamra.org and fill out an online application.

Nitro, formerly known as Randy and adopted as a young dog in 2011 is coming back to us due to change in life circumstances.  More information as we get to know Nitro again.

If you are interested in this dog, or any of our other dogs, please go to www.iamra.org and fill out an online application.

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Please contact Lia (liareneeelliott@gmail.com), (317) 514-9962 for more information about this pet.
Online Adoption Application âº
Young Whimsical Charmer!With the Chandler Bing accent, could I BE any cuter?! Do you adore furry big loveable dogs? If so, this could be a great match! Halle is a young, female Alaskan Malamute. Fun, silly, prancy, submissive and playful....she will make a great addition to an active and loving family. Halle is wonderful with humans (adult and children) as well as other dogs of all sizes. She is very young and playful so a home with another dog would need to match her energy level for a mutually loveable fit. Halle is potty trained, walks (or I should say 'prances') on a leash very well, is crate trained, knows some basic commands, and is a super sweet girl. She goes to dog day care on workdays and socializes with other dogs incredibly well. Halle's perfect forever home will need to be a residential home (no apartments/condos) and will need a large yard with a secure fence (min. 6 feet). She needs an active family who wants to play with her as much as she will want to play with them to be sure she gets her young pup energy out (which will help to minimize risk of any destructive tendencies forming). All CARE dogs are up to date on their vaccinations and preventatives as of their adoption day, spayed/neutered, and microchipped.If you have any questions, please email Halle's foster mom at liareneeelliott@gmail.com or text /call 317-514-9962 4/11/18 9:38 AM

Hello, my name is Noche and I am a sweet well mannered 8 year Alaskan Malamute! I have been at the shelter since early October searching for my forever home. I would love to find a home soon as I am a great dog, and I will be a great companion for you. For an older gentleman I am quite active, yet I still have my calm side. I perk up so much when I get to go on walks! I am microchipped, neutered, and current on my vaccinations. Please note, I am a bigger boy and I do have some hair loss due to my thyroid condition. I should not be in a home with any cats. I have a strong prey drive and will go after smaller animals. I am wonderful on a leash and can be around other animals leashed.  I would probably be best as a single pet.  Good news my adoption has been sponsored and I can go home with you for free!



OAHS is able to accommodate same day adoptions.  The adoptions are based on a first-come basis providing it is a good match for everyone involved. 
The first step in the adoption process is to complete our adoption questionnaire to ensure we can help find the right fit for you.  An adoption interview is required prior to adoption.  An Adoption Counselor will ask about your residence, family members and pet experience.  The Adoption Counselor will also address any concerns and answer any questions that you may have about adding a new pet to your family.

OAHS is State of Wisconsin licensed and inspected: 268244-DS.

Many area veterinarians are offering a free health exam and/or other discounted services for pets adopted from a humane society. Please contact your local vets regarding any applicable discounts.   

OAHS is open Monday 1-5pm, Wednesday 1-6pm, Friday 1-5pm, Saturday 11am-3pm, and Sunday 11am-3pm.  We are located at 150 S. Katch Avenue behind the Oconto Veterinary Center in Oconto, Wisconsin. From Hwy 41, go west onto Hwy 22, north onto Van Hecke Avenue, and east onto S. Katch Avenue.

Meet Nelly! He Is A 6 Year Old Male Boxer/American Bulldog Mix. He Is Neutered, Up To Date On Vaccines, Heartworm Negative, And Microchipped. He Is Currently Being Treated For Hookworm And Has One Pill Left To Take And Should Be Good To Go. What Can I Say About This Goofball. He Is Amazing! Hes A Big Ole Baby! He LOVES Everyone He Meets And Has No Issues With Strangers Or Kids. He Has Not Shown One Ounce Of Aggression At All. He Hasnt Been Socialized Around Other Animals And Has Proved To Be A Cat Chaser. Nelly Has Been Slowly Introduced To The Resident Dogs And Over Time Has Come To Accept Them And Is Able To Now Be Part Of The Pack. Im Not Sure How He Would Be With Other Dogs, It Would Take Take And Work To Put Him In A Home With Other Dogs.  He Loves Kids Though And Has Really Enjoyed Hanging Out At My 10 Year Olds Football Games On The Weekends.He Is On Point Trained. He Has Never Once Had An Accident Or Marked In My Home. He Will Walk Right Into His Crate When I Say "Bed Time". He Knows "Sit" And "Stay" And We Are Working On Doorway Boundaries. He Has Some Bulldog Pushyness And It Mostly Comes Out When He Wants To Snuggle. He Does Not Take No For An Answer. Ive Been A Human Shaped Dog Bed More Since We Have Been Fostering Nelly Than Ever Before. He Just Cant Seem To Get Close Enough To His People. He Is A 55# Lap Dog. He Does Also Like To Climb. As You Can See In His Photos He Enjoys Sleeping In The Cat Tower. Weirdo Dog! We Will Be Looking For At Least A 6 Ft Fence As He Can Climb A 4 Ft No Problem. We Have Kept Him On A Lead At Our Home. He Does Pretty Good Off-Leash As Long As You Are Paying Attention To Him And Has Excellent Voice Recall. Ill Make This Promise. Ehoever Adopts This Boy Wont Ever Give Him Up. Hes Hilareous And A Joy To Have Around. His Bad Habits Are Minor And Are Workable. One Last Note Is His Tongue. We Arent Sure If Its A Birth Defect Or Trauma But He Cannot Atick His Tongue All The Way In His Mouth. This Does Make Him A Bit Of A Drooler At Times. It Doesnt Bother Him But Will Need To Be Paid Attention To On Cold Winter Days. He Eats Fine Although Can Be Messy With His Food Bowl As He Eats From The Side Of His Mouth. He Also Can Only Give Kisses If You Happen To Be On That Side Of His Face. His Adoption Donation Is $260.  For more uodates, pictures, and videos of Nelly please "LIKE" us on facebook. Facebook.com/AllforkarmaAnimalRescue. Visit Allforkarmaanimalrescue.com to fill out an application to adopt.

Rambo is a young male Pit Mix who was also rescued by Roughneck Rescue with his brother Luke. Rambo is a 75 pound medium energy athletic hunk.  He is a go anywhere, do everything kind of a dog and will make a great companion! He is neutered, UTD on all shots and heart-worm negative. Rambo will need a fenced yard.

If you are interested in becoming Rambo's Pack Leader, please visit our website at www.roughneckrescue.org and complete the on-line application from the Adoption Process tab to get things started.

Are you a member of the U.S. Military? Check out Pets for Patriots for more information on the adoption program.  Rambo qualifies for the Pets for Patriots adoption program.

Every dog that is adopted from Roughneck Rescue will have one on one time with dog behaviorist Danny Davis, admission to workshops with K-9 Behavior Rehabilitation and on-going support as needed.

Our mission is to give you and your new family member every chance for a successful future together!

Meet Carl!  Heâs a young, happy-go-lucky kind of a dog. UTD on all shots, neutered, micro-chipped, house-trained and on heart-worm preventative. Carl will need a fenced yard. If you are interested in adopting Carl, please visit our website at www.roughneckrescue.org and complete the on-line application from the Adoption Process tab to get things started.

Roughneck Rescue is proud to be an adoption partner with Pets for Patriots. Are you a member of the U.S. Military? Check out Pets for Patriots for more information on their adoption program at www.petsforpatriots.org/partners/roughneck-resue. 

Every dog that is adopted from Roughneck Rescue will have one on one time with dog behaviorist Danny Davis admission to workshops with K-9 Behavior Rehabilitation, invitation to our weekly Walk Club and on-going support as needed. In addition, your new best friend will be micro-chipped, spayed/neutered, UTD on all shots and receive a 30 day gift of Pet Insurance provided by 24PetWatch. Our mission is to give you and your new family member every chance for a successful future together!

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
STAR is a foster-based rescue. All our rescue animals stay in foster homes until adoption. We do not have a central facility. If you want to meet any of our adoptables please submit an application.

Hi, my name is Stitches and as you can see by my big smiles I am one happy boy but would sure love to find my furever home with a family to love. I am such a good boy and I'm pretty darn cute with my polka dot ears. I love to play, go for car rides and just be around people. I would love to have my own family to show just how much love I have to give and being such a silly boy I will have you in Stitches. With Love Stitches.

All STAR animals come vetted, Up to Date (UTD) on age appropriate shots and testing, spay and neutered (if of age,) and microchipped.

AGE DISCLAIMER:
Unfortunately, most of the orphaned animals that come into our rescue looking for homes donât bring birth certificates. Sometimes we know our petsâ ages. Sometimes we donât. So we make our best guess based on the condition of their teeth and the veterinarians best guess.
BREED DISCLAIMER:
Visual breed identification in dogs is unreliable so for most of the dogs we are only guessing at predominant breed or breed mix. We get to know each dog as an individual and will do our best to describe each of our dogs based on personality,
not
by breed label .
Microchips:
For the safety of our dogs and peace of mind of our fosters and adopters, STAR microchips all dogs prior to adoption with Petlink Microchips. Please understand that all dogs MUST still wear a collar with ID tags (which include your current information) AT ALL TIMES. Please remember, our foster dogs are extremely important to us-- we will always take any of our dogs back, if for any reason you can't keep your adopted dog. Never surrender him/her to a shelter!

Nana and her 11 puppies, who were several days old, were brought to SAFARI. She was found to be heartworm positive, so after she raised all her puppies, she went through treatment for her heartworm. She is now healthy, heartworm negative and ready to find a family to call her own. She is a lovable young lady who loves to cuddle and give kisses.
Birth Date: 09/01/2013

Visit SAFARI's website www.safarianimalrescue.org for a full listing of adoptable animals. Please check out the Upcoming Events menu for a list of upcoming adoption events.

**Please contact us before an adoption event, to verify that the animal you are interested in will be in attendance. 

***At this time we are unable to accommodate out of state adoptions, or adoptions outside the metro Detroit area. Information requests on any of SAFARI's animals should be directed to us via email. With the call volume we receive, we are unable to return all inquiry phone calls due to time restraints. Listed breeds are a best guess based on animal appearance, and should in no way be considered a guarantee of breed.

Special Animal Friends and Rescue, Inc. (SAFARI) is a non-profit, no-kill,  foster based animal rescue. SAFARI is currently seeking foster parents, volunteers, and donation to fund the continued rescue of these deserving animals.

Hi. I am Rafiki, I am new to LDDR and my foster mom is getting to know me. She says I ride great in the car. I like other dogs that I have met. I am very lovable and like to cuddle. I walk fairly well on leash. I am housebroken. Check back for more updates as my foster mom learns more about me. Last Day Dog Rescue now microchips all animals before adoption. Microchips are implanted between the animals shoulder blades and are a permanent form of identification. The microchips are registered to Last Day Dog Rescue with the adopter's info added once adopted. If the animal is ever lost and slips his/her collar/tags the microchip allows the finder to know who to contact if scanned for a microchip. Animals MUST still have a collar with tags on at all times. Per our contract, we take all our animals back if for any reason you can't keep your adopted animal.

The Petfinder.com system requires that we choose a predominant breed or breed mix for our animals. Visual breed identification in animals is unreliable so for most of the animals we are only guessing at predominant breed or breed mix. We get to know each animal as an individual and will do our best to describe each of our animals based on personality, not by breed label.

Thank you for looking through our list of animals needing forever homes and choosing rescue first. We appreciate you stopping by.

The information that you provide on the application will help us determine whether the dog that you have chosen is a good match for you so please give as much detail as possible. You must be at least 25 years old to apply. Please answer all questions; otherwise your pre-application may not be reviewed. Include the following information in your email:

1. Your name, address, home phone number & email address. How long have you lived at present address?

2. Age of applicant? Age of co-applicant? Do you live with your parents?

3. Your reason for wanting to adopt this dog? Are you adopting for yourself, family, others, gift/surprise, hunting, watch dog, childâs pet, companion?

4. Type of housing you live in (own home, apartment, condo, mobile home, etc.). If you rent please provide the name of the complex and landlord's phone number.

5. Is your yard Completely Fenced, Partially Fenced, Not Fenced or you have No Yard? How high is your fence? What type of fence: Chain Link, Privacy Fence, Invisible Fence, Other? If no fence, how do you plan on keeping your dog contained in the yard?

6. Number of adults and children in the home, and the ages of the children? Relationship of adults? (Married, Fiance, Older-Children, Roommate , Parent , Other ) Are all household members in agreement with adopting this pet?

7. What arrangements have you made to care for the pet in case you can no longer do so?

8. The number of hours per day the animal will be left alone, and where you will keep the animal when left alone?

9. How much time do your current/previous pet spend outdoors? How much time would this new pet spend outdoors? Where will this dog be routinely living?

10. A list of any animals you've had in the last 10 years, including how long you had them and where they are now. Please include the names of each animal, and the type of animal. 

11. Are/were they spayed/neutered? Current on vaccines? On heartworm prevention (dog)?

12. The name and PHONE NUMBER of current or prior veterinarians in the past 5 years. We will be contacting your veterinarian as a reference. Please contact your vet clinic and give them permission to release your pets information. Are the pets listed under your name, if not please list name pet is listed under?

13. The average cost per for providing preventive veterinary care is $200.00 - $500.00. Additionally there are expenses of food, toys, grooming, boarding, emergency veterinary care, etc, does your household budget allow you to comfortably cover these expenses?

14. How do you plan on exercising this dog? 

15. Are you willing to enroll this dog in obedience training? If no, what are your plans for training this dog?

16.Rescue animals require time to adjust to their new home. Are you willing to give this animal adequate time for proper adjustment - perhaps three weeks or more? What amount of time do you consider to be reasonable for adjustment?

17. Would you object to someone for WAG Animal Rescue coming/calling your home to check on the dog?

18. What behaviors would you be unable to tolerate from an adopted dog? (potty accidents; jumping up on furniture; playing in early am hours; barking; getting into garbage cans; counter surfing; getting on furniture; hiding from guests/other family members; shedding hair on furniture/clothes; chewing; escaping; fighting; digging.)

19. Methods I plan to use to discourage unwanted behavior(s): (Yell; put dog in another room; remove problem item(s); put dog in crate; put dog outside; I will not tolerate bad behavior; swat/spank/hit with newspaper; spritz with water; throw something at dog; who cares dog are dogs.)

20.You understand that rescue dogs may have unknown medical history/problems and/or unknown behavior issues?

21. Additional information you would like to provide to WAG: 


The above information that I have provided to WAG Animal Rescue for the purpose of adopting an animal is accurate and complete.Please put in subject line the name of the animal you are interested in.

A volunteer will review your application and contact you ONLY if you are approved or if further clarification is required. We will make every attempt to contact approved applicants within 5 business days of application submission (M-F), but this will depend on the number of applications received. Please be patient while we processes your adoption applications. We want to be sure that the best match possible is made, so that the dog does not end up needing re-homing again.Please understand that by answering the questions does not guarantee the adoption of the pet, nor are you obligated to adopt the pet.

WAG Animal Rescue adopts to homes that are best fits for our animals' needs, and not on a first-come, first-served basis. If you currently own a dog or have a history of dog ownership, you must provide a vet reference for your application to be processed. Preference is given to applications with prior dog experience and vet references. We are an all-volunteer organization, and regret that we do not have the resources to contact applicants that are not approved. Thank you for your understanding and cooperation.

Approved applicants are based on best fit, not first submitted. WAG RESERVES THE RIGHT TO REFUSE ANY APPLICANT, so please understand that it is within our discretion to make those decisions on behalf of our animals. Keep in mind that we depend 100% on volunteers, most of whom have full-time jobs, so we ask for your understanding as we do the best we can in the endless effort to find homes for these deserving animals!

Please remember.......our first and ONLY consideration is the safety and happiness of our dogs.

THANK YOU FOR YOUR INTEREST IN A RESCUE DOG!

Lance is an amazing intelligent 10 month old, 50lb, large breed puppy that has survived incredible odds to become what he is today: An active happy boy who is able to walk a mile and enjoys the company of other dogs!  Lance was found on the streets of San Antonio, TX in April 2017 near a yard filled with junk and debris. He was brought to Animal Control Services partially paralyzed. His first reports indicated that he was in much pain, but was able to move his legs in random motions. He was given a bed, pain meds, and some time to recover from whatever caused his paralysis. Because he was deemed unadoptable :/ he was also listed for euthanasia.  Lance was brought to the attention of Compass Dog Rescue through a FB video (shared earlier and in our photo library), and that is where his story really begins: Through incredible fostering, some generous pledges for his medical needs, a nutritious diet, some physical therapy and the perseverance by one determined dog, Lance is now walking a mile a day and is ready to start his forever home search.  In his current foster home Lance has learned to walk on a leash, and he is also crate trained. He rides well in the car and looks forward to going on outings to local doggy friendly places. Lance loves to meet new people and seems to take new environments in stride. Lance is also attending obedience classes and may progress to doggie socialization groups. Lance is still working on housetraining, but that is due is some part to the delay in him having use of his hind quarters.. He likes to be clean and works hard to stay that way. For the most part, he is successful. He knows how to sit, down and is learning 'wait' for his foster mom to lead before going in and out of doors. He is highly trainable and has the drive and stamina for much more given the right environment. He seems to want the company of other dogs, and likes to try to do whatever they do - so an older dog that knows the ropes and can help Lance learn to be a great dog would be an asset in his next home. Although Lance lived with a cat in his previous foster home, and has been around cats in his current home, he does show too much interest in them for us to recommend a home with cats.  Because of Lance's injury and consideration around that, his ideal home would be child free or have dog savy children 12 and up. His foster family would prefer no electric fencing or tie-outs for Lance - so a physically fenced in yard would also be best. Previous breed experience with a dog from working lines (German Shepherd, Belgian Malinois, Cane Corso) is a plus, as Lance is exceptionally intelligent and will do best in a home with experience with dogs that are driven to do a job well. Lance is an exceptional dog, who deserves an outstanding home that can support him and guide him to continue to be the best dog he can become. They need to understand that he has come so far but should his physical defects not resolve completely - will love him anyway.  A village stepped up to rescue Lance and we are looking for a very special adoptive family for him that will be able to help him continue on his amazing journey. We are here to provide all the information that we have to help anyone interested make a good and informed decision. Anyone with interest in this darling miracle of a boy, please inquire today!

This evaluation is generally conducted with one dog of the same gender and one of the opposite. This temperament testing is designed to avoid reintroducing dog aggressive dogs back into the community where they have the potential of hurting other dogs, humans and the reputation of their breed.Dog relationships can be just as complex and complicated as human relationships at times. We recommend separating any new additions in the home while unsupervised until a comfortable relationship has been established. Is this the right breed for me or my family?  5. Can I afford the food and vet care for this dog?  6. Is it best to have a totally fenced yard?  7. Will I make a commitment to obedience training?

This guy is happy and friendly but unfortunately has been waiting too long for someone to notice him.   He loves his people and will let you know it as he is very loyal and loving toward his foster dad. He does well with most dogs but better with the females.  Zeek is a strong guy who is learning his manners. He is food motivated which helps with his training. Zeek would be fine as an only dog so he can get the focus of his new family.  A home with older kids is recommended as he can jump high. He  would thrive with a person who is active and can take him on walks/runs every day. Zeek is deserving of a chance for a family of his own. Birth date 6/1/14

A volunteer found this little guy on the edge of the street, likely "dumped" due to his deformity. The vet has determined that Trooper's leg was fractured in more than one place, and it most likely occurred at birth. But since this injury was never corrected, he has some muscle atrophy and gait issues. He has undergone surgery on his leg but unfortunately it never healed the way we hoped. The vet thought it best to have it amputated. Trooper just underwent the procedure March 9, and  has recovered and adjusted. He is as sweet as can be  Awwwww! He will be adopted by his foster family.
Estimated DOB 4/13/16

NOT FOR ADOPTION - BREED INFO ONLY!!!!!!!!--------------------------------------------------------------------------------If you see a dog like this, it is most likely an "American Eskimo Dog".  Some call them "Spitz", but that term  refers to a type of dog which can generally be identified by a tail that curls over its back.  Included in the spitz category would be the American Eskimo Dog, Husky, Keeshond, German Spitz and Pomeranian, just to name a few.---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  American Eskimo Dogs tend to be reserved on first meeting, then become velcro, cuddle bunnies, lap doggies, glue...you get the idea.  They are intelligent, loving, devoted to their people, and love to be with you.  They generally live 15+ years and tend to be much more active and healthy into later years than some other breeds.  They are fun, playful, and LOVE to run!! Most require a fenced yard or the opportunity to run (safely) off leash on a daily basis.  They are watch doggies in that they will bark as arrivals or strange noises outside, alerting the family to trouble.-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  "Eskies", their common nick name, come in 3 sizes:  standard, mini and toy.  Although it is determined by height (about 9-12", 12-15, 15-19) you can estimate by weight.  Under #10 will be a toy....may be a few pounds heavier but generally NOT more than #13, most MINIs are 10-20# maybe up to #22 at times....and about 20-35# would be a standard.  Some books say they can be up to #40, but most are not, and recent breeding has moved toward smaller, more delicate features.  -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------   Eskies are often confused with Samoyed, which are also a spitz breed but are larger, have a slightly different frame and shape and are more likely to weigh over #40.  I can guarantee that if it weighs #70, it is NOT an eskie!!!---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  Eskies do shed, but the better the diet, the more they shed seasonally, but they do shed and if you don't want some hair on the furniture, they are not the breed for you.  Most folks who meet, foster or babysit one fall in love with their natures because they are SO loving and total attention sponges who will suck up for some love at every opportunity.  My male loves to go visiting and make the rounds of everyone in the room.  Also, when you own such a beautiful dog, everyone stops to ask what breed it is, etc.  -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  HOWEVER, this is NOT the breed for everyone.  Some folks adopt one due to beauty alone and do not realize these dogs NEED and DEMAND your time.  They are a strong-minded breed and must be trained firmly, but never harshly.  They do NOT respond to harsh training methods at all and can be ruined by such treatment.  Also, as puppies, then can be little rambo puppies with rockets on their feet.  I know - I got my first as a puppy and hated him by 4 months!!  They are all go go go active bouncing zooming puppy who LOVES to chew and get in all sorts of trouble. If you don't find something for puppy to do, or leave him alone too long, puppy will make it s own games and you will NOT like them.  ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------So, please DO NOT ADOPT an eskie just because they are gorgeous.  They can become wonderful, devoted and loving companions, but they are a handful as puppies....much more so than some other breeds.  Eskies are very puppish and I don't consider them adults until 3+ years, and they also do not get their full adult coat until then.  So,you may want to consider an excellent, playful, puppyish young one over a puppy, unless you do research and really know what you are getting in to.  That is why so many end up in pounds at 6 months to a year - folks who adopted them and have no patience, time or understanding of how to train them and turn them into excellent adults.  I myself prefer eskies that are 3+ and 5 is a wonderful age!!!! ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Remember that eskies can live very healthy lives past 15+....some 18 years, so don't overlook the seniors out there!  I 've seen 14-15 year olds who bop all around, love walks, dance emphatically for treats, etc.

Snowball (Snowy) -  One really sweet little boy who truly loves his person.  He gets along with big and little dogs and even the cats, of course if they run, he will chase them.  He can be a little shy at first but after he feels he can trust you he is just a little snuggle bug.  He loves to cuddle with his people and loves to play with his pal Stevie who is a blind Shih Tzu.  He frightens easily and doesnât like yelling and or really loud noises.  No children under the age of 5 for they may be too noisy for this little guy.  He is crate trained, walks well on a leash and rides great in the car.  He can be indifferent when meeting dogs for the first time, if they are too forward before he gets a chance to know what they are all about then he may bite them,  so it is best to let the dogs figure each other out slowly.  Once he has learned their dog language then he is great.  He gets along with everyone at my house but with new comers, if they cause a fuss, he will let them know.  If you are looking to add an addition to your family and are looking for a really terrific little guy then come meet him.  He is not at the kennels but in a foster home.  He is neutered and up to date on all shots and heartworm tested and on preventative.   Since Snowball is in a foster home, please fill out an application at www.k9stray.com and his foster mom will be in touch!

Hi I'm Dakota! I'm a 10 year old American Eskimo. I'm a happy, cheery guy, and I'm good with other dogs. I've lived with my mom my whoooooole life until now. She's very sick and can no longer care for me. She loves me a lot and I hope my new family will love me just as much. I'm pretty laid back, don't need an active family or person, and I enjoy my comfort, I love my doggie bed. I'm house broken and even used to being boarded when my mommy used to go on trips and I don't mind that. I'm a good boy & I hope you'll give me a chance!

Dakota's adoption fee is $175All of our dogs are spayed or neutered, up to date on age appropriate vaccinations, microchipped and if over 6 months of age, heartworm tested or on heartworm preventative in their foster home.

To apply for this adoptable dog, visit www.adoptapitrescue.org/apply and fill out the Adoption Application.

We typically adopt within a 2 hour radius of Dayton, Ohio.

Crystal lived outside with Autumn but is now an inside companion. She is about 8 years old and an American Eskimo. She is housebroken and would like a quiet home. She is spayed, heart worm tested, microchipped and vaccinated. Crystal gets along with other dogs but doesn't play with other dogs. Her adoption donation is $200.Help raise money for our rescue dogs; donation can be made via PayPal account - purebredrescue@onebox.com.
You must be willing to commute to the location that the pet is being fostered in order to be eligible to adopt. We do not ship our pets. We also require that you personally bring the pet back to us should the adoption not work out.
We do NOT negotiate adoption fees. Our fees have not changed in years, although vetting, food, supplies, etc has all gone up. All money goes to our dogs and the running of this rescue. We are 100% volunteered based.
Adoption fees are non-refundable.

Your current dog must be current on vaccines and on heartworm prevention.
